fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.condition

Annotation Type RequiredClass


  • @Target(value=TYPE)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface RequiredClass
    This annotation is used with RequiredClasses and its aim is to provide more options on how to handle required classes.

    This annotation is used to indicate the following information:

    • One of several class must be present
    • One or several classes must not be present
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      String value
      The required class

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String[] alternatives
      The other classes that are alternative or aliases of the primary class provided by attribute value().
      String[] excludes
      If one of the classes provided by this attribute is in the classpath, then the implementation can't be used.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract String value
        The required class
        Returns:
        the require class

      • excludes

        public abstract String[] excludes
        If one of the classes provided by this attribute is in the classpath, then the implementation can't be used.

        This attribute can be used in conjunction with value(). For example: 

         @RequiredClass(value="com.sendgrid.SendGrid", except="com.cloudhopper.smpp.SmppSession")
        Means that the class com.sendgrid.SendGrid must be present. If the classpath also contains com.cloudhopper.smpp.SmppSession then it indicates that the implementation can't be used.

        If both value() and excludes() are provided, then the implementation can be used only if all the classes provided in value() are available in the classpath and none of the classes provided in excludes() is in the classpath.

        Returns:
        the list of excluded classes
        Default:
        {}

      • alternatives

        public abstract String[] alternatives
        The other classes that are alternative or aliases of the primary class provided by attribute value().

        Attribute {excludes() is common for every alternative. For Example: 

         @RequiredClass(value="com.sendgrid.SendGrid1", alternatives="com.sendgrid.SendGrid2")
        Means that the implementation can be used either if the class com.sendgrid.SendGrid1 is present or if the class com.sendgrid.SendGrid2 is present.
        Returns:
        the list of alternative classes
        Default:
        {}
